description.short: Conjure simple, non-living solid matter like stone, wood, or metal.
description.player: You reach into the raw Aether and pull forth solid matter, giving it shape and form through will and knowledge.

outcomes.10+: You create a solid, well-formed object up to the size of a backpack. It is durable and lasts for about a day.
outcomes.7-9: The creation is flawed. Choose one: it's misshapen and fragile, it will only last for an hour, OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The Aether surges. You fail to create the object, and you gain 1 Temporary Corruption as the raw essence harms you.

description.short: Conjure basic liquids like water, oil, or acid.
description.player: Through careful manipulation of the Aether, you manifest liquid substances from nothing.

outcomes.10+: You create about a gallon of the desired liquid in a container or on a surface. It is pure and stable.
outcomes.7-9: The liquid is impure or unstable. It's a smaller quantity, it's tinged with a strange color/smell, OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The liquid manifests explosively, splashing harmlessly but creating a mess and achieving nothing useful.

description.short: Conjure clouds of smoke, breathable air, or noxious fumes.
description.player: You shape the Aether into gaseous form, creating clouds of various substances.

outcomes.10+: You create a thick cloud of the desired gas about 10 feet in diameter. It lasts for several minutes before dissipating.
outcomes.7-9: The cloud is thin and dissipates quickly, OR the effort of containing it adds 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool.
outcomes.6-: You conjure the wrong gas entirely, creating a strange smell or a harmless but startling visual effect.

description.short: Conjure raw, simple energy, like a spark of flame, a flash of light, or a floating orb of heat.
description.player: The most dangerous of Creation magics, manifesting pure energy from the Aether.

outcomes.10+: You create a controlled manifestation of energy that lasts for the scene or until you dismiss it.
outcomes.7-9: The energy is unstable. It flickers erratically, it's weaker than intended, OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The energy discharges harmlessly in a shower of sparks, failing to achieve the desired effect.

description.short: Extend your will to move a physical object you can see.
description.player: Through force of will, you reach out with invisible hands of Aether to manipulate the physical world.

outcomes.10+: You move an object (up to 50 lbs) with precision and control.
outcomes.7-9: Your control is clumsy. You move the object but make a loud noise, drop it halfway, or knock other things over.
outcomes.6-: You lose your grip. The object flies in a random direction, or you inadvertently affect the wrong object entirely.

description.short: Exert your will over an existing, uncontrolled elemental source.
description.player: You impose your will upon the natural forces, bending fire, water, air, and earth to your command.

outcomes.10+: You command the element to perform one clear action (e.g., the fire erupts, water forms a shield, wind slams a door).
outcomes.7-9: Your control is incomplete. The effect is weaker than intended, lasts only a moment, OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The element rebels. The fire leaps towards you, the water splashes back, the wind blows dust in your eyes.

description.short: Temporarily imbue a simple object with movement and a single, simple command.
description.player: You breathe temporary life into the inanimate, creating crude but effective servants.

outcomes.10+: The object animates and follows your command faithfully for the scene or until its task is complete.
outcomes.7-9: The animation is literal and witless, or the Aetheric binding is sloppy, adding 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool.
outcomes.6-: The animating spirit is mischievous or inept, causing a complication.

description.short: Alter the structural integrity of a non-living object you can touch.
description.player: Through transmutation, you rewrite the fundamental strength of materials, making steel brittle or wood unbreakable.

outcomes.10+: You significantly strengthen or weaken the object for about an hour.
outcomes.7-9: The effect works, but only lasts for a few minutes OR creates a visible, unnatural shimmer.
outcomes.6-: The transmutation fails catastrophically, shattering the object or making it incredibly durable.

description.short: Alter the physical state of a simple, non-living material (solid, liquid, gas).
description.player: You command matter to shift between states, freezing water instantly or vaporizing metal.

outcomes.10+: You change a significant amount of material for about an hour.
outcomes.7-9: The change is minor in scope OR costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The change is uncontrolled, transforming the material into an unexpected state or expanding violently.

description.short: Temporarily change a single property of an object you touch.
description.player: You rewrite one fundamental quality of matter, making rope as hard as steel or cloth as heavy as lead.

outcomes.10+: The object's property is changed as you desire (e.g., rope becomes steel) for about an hour.
outcomes.7-9: The change is unstable, lasting only a few minutes OR has a visible side effect.
outcomes.6-: The transmutation fails, giving the object a bizarre and useless property.

description.short: Change the physical shape of a non-living object without changing its core material.
description.player: Like a sculptor working in flesh and stone, you reshape matter with thought alone.

outcomes.10+: You reshape the object with precision, like a master sculptor.
outcomes.7-9: The reshaping is crude and rushed, functional but imperfect, OR costs 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The object resists the change, twisting into a useless, warped version of your intent.

description.short: Focus on a location or object to glimpse a significant event from its history.
description.player: All things leave echoes in the Aether. You reach back through time to witness what has been.

outcomes.10+: You receive a clear, useful vision of an important event from the last 24 hours.
outcomes.7-9: The vision is fragmented, symbolic, or inflicts 1 Stun damage to your Intellect.
outcomes.6-: You connect to a meaningless or misleading psychic echo.

description.short: Attempt to perceive events happening at a distance right now.
description.player: You cast your senses through the Aether to witness distant events as they unfold.

outcomes.10+: You see and hear what is happening at a known location as if you were there, for about one minute.
outcomes.7-9: The sensory connection is poor (blurry images, muffled sounds) OR your scrying is detected.
outcomes.6-: Your psychic senses land on the wrong location entirely.

description.short: Meditate on a course of action to glimpse its most likely outcome.
description.player: The future is a tapestry of probability. You peer through the threads to see what might come to pass.

outcomes.10+: The GM describes the single most probable result if you take that action.
outcomes.7-9: The vision is unhelpful (confusingly symbolic, only shows what not to do) OR is so grim it costs 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: You see a vision of a future that will not come to pass, based on flawed variables.

description.short: Focus on a target to sense its sympathetic resonance.
description.player: All things are connected through invisible threads of sympathy. You perceive these bonds.

outcomes.10+: You clearly perceive one significant connection the target has (person, place, or object).
outcomes.7-9: The information is incomplete, symbolic, or you draw unwanted attention from the other end of the connection.
outcomes.6-: You learn nothing useful and suffer 1 Stun damage from psychic feedback.

description.short: Use an existing connection (hair, blood, item) to affect a target from a distance.
description.player: Through sympathetic magic, you turn connection into power, using a piece of someone to reach the whole.

outcomes.10+: Your magic flows perfectly, delivering a touch-range spell, 1 Stun damage, or a strong emotional state.
outcomes.7-9: The link is unstable; the effect works but adds 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The bond snaps or backfires, targeting you instead with a lesser effect.

description.short: Perform a ritual to create a new, temporary sympathetic link between two targets.
description.player: Through lengthy ritual, you weave new threads of connection where none existed before.

outcomes.10+: You successfully create a powerful two-way link for one day (shared emotions, senses, etc.).
outcomes.7-9: The bond is flawed: it only lasts for an hour, is one-way only, OR costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The ritual fails, creating a dissonant connection to something entirely unexpected and dangerous.

description.short: Immediate battlefield healing for stabilizing injuries.
description.player: Through the Healing Sphere, you channel life-giving Aether to mend wounds and stabilize the dying.

outcomes.10+: Clear two ticked boxes from one location's Stun Track OR one box from its Health Boxes.
outcomes.7-9: Messy or taxing: clear only one Stun box, the healing leaves a scar, OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The Aether is rejected. The healing fails, inflicting 1 Stun damage on your target.

description.short: A slower, more deliberate Move to combat diseases, poisons, and infections.
description.player: You identify the corruption within the body and burn it away with purifying Aether.

outcomes.10+: You successfully identify and purge the ailment.
outcomes.7-9: You only suppress the symptoms for a time, OR the cure is successful but costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: You misdiagnose or the treatment fails, making the condition worse.

description.short: Advanced biological alteration to fix long-term problems or install augmentations.
description.player: The most advanced form of healing magic, allowing you to reshape flesh and bone as a sculptor works clay.

outcomes.10+: The procedure is a complete success. The chronic condition is fixed or the limb is regrown.
outcomes.7-9: Success with a complication: a cosmetic flaw, a side effect, OR the process taints you with 1 Permanent Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The procedure goes horribly wrong, creating an unintended and monstrous mutation.

description.short: Infuse a dead body with Aether to create an undead servant.
description.player: You force false life into the dead, commanding the corpse to rise and serve.

outcomes.10+: You animate a corpse as a loyal, functional undead servant that will follow your commands until destroyed.
outcomes.7-9: The animation is flawed: the servant is slow, it follows commands too literally, OR the act costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The spirit inhabiting the corpse is hostile or uncontrolled and will act on its own violent impulses.

description.short: Create a conduit to drain the vitality from another living being.
description.player: The darkest of necromantic arts, stealing life itself to sustain your own.

outcomes.10+: You successfully drain a target's life force, inflicting 2 Stun damage and healing 2 of your own Stun boxes.
outcomes.7-9: The process is foul. You succeed, but the act taints you, and you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The conduit backfires. You fail to drain the target, and the attempt inflicts 1 Stun damage on yourself.

description.short: Reach across the veil to question a spirit.
description.player: You call forth the departed to extract knowledge from beyond death's threshold.

outcomes.10+: You make a clear connection. The spirit is willing (or compelled) to answer 3 questions truthfully.
outcomes.7-9: The connection is weak. The spirit will only answer one question, its answers are cryptic, OR the contact draws unwanted attention.
outcomes.6-: You connect with a lying or insane spirit that gives you dangerous misinformation.

description.short: Conjure a mobile, personal shield of shimmering Aether to deflect harm.
description.player: You weave a protective barrier of solidified Aether that follows your movements.

outcomes.10+: Your shield is potent. It has 3 'Shield Boxes' that are ticked off before your Health/Stun boxes. It lasts for the scene.
outcomes.7-9: Your shield is weaker. It only has 1 Shield Box, OR the effort adds 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool.
outcomes.6-: The Aether fails to cohere. The shield shatters as it forms.

description.short: Inscribe a runic array to create a large, stationary barrier of force.
description.player: Through careful runic work, you raise a wall of solidified magic to defend a position.

outcomes.10+: You create a powerful, unmoving barrier that can withstand significant punishment for the scene.
outcomes.7-9: The barrier is flawed. It has a weak spot, it only lasts for a few minutes, OR the effort costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The runic array is unstable. The barrier collapses moments after you create it.

description.short: Create a magical 'trap' or passive defense on a location or object. The more specific the target, the more powerful the effect.
description.player: You inscribe protective glyphs that lie dormant until triggered by the unwary.

outcomes.10+: The Ward is inscribed perfectly. Broad Target (any living being) = minor effect. Specific Target (e.g., Red Sentinels) = potent effect. Unique Target (one person) = devastating effect.
outcomes.7-9: The Ward is flawed. Its trigger is unreliable, its effect is weaker, OR the inscription costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The Ward is unstable. It might not trigger, or it might trigger on the wrong person (like you).

description.short: Open your mind to communicate with a nearby, unseen spirit.
description.player: You extend your consciousness into the spirit realm to speak with the unseen.

outcomes.10+: You make a clear, two-way connection and can have a short, coherent conversation.
outcomes.7-9: The connection has static. You get a single, cryptic image or draw the attention of an unwanted entity.
outcomes.6-: You connect to a hostile, lying, or insane spirit that feeds you dangerous misinformation or attacks you.

description.short: Exert your will upon a spirit to force it into a vessel or drive it from a location.
description.player: Through force of personality and magical authority, you command spirits to obey.

outcomes.10+: You succeed completely. The spirit is securely bound or is banished for at least a day.
outcomes.7-9: You succeed, but at a cost. The effort costs you 1 Temporary Corruption OR the banishment is temporary (one hour).
outcomes.6-: Your will is insufficient. The spirit resists and its backlash inflicts 1 Stun damage to your Presence.

description.short: Engage in a formal negotiation with a spirit, offering something of value for a service.
description.player: You enter into a binding contract with a spirit, trading favors across the veil.

outcomes.10+: The spirit agrees to the pact and will perform one significant service for you.
outcomes.7-9: The spirit agrees, but it drives a hard bargain, demanding a higher price or offering a lesser service.
outcomes.6-: You offend the spirit. It refuses your offer and may become hostile.

description.short: Create a small bubble of altered time around an object or willing person.
description.player: You bend the flow of time itself, creating pockets where seconds stretch or compress.

outcomes.10+: The effect is stable and localized, completing a task in half the time or slowing an object to a crawl.
outcomes.7-9: The time bubble is unstable, causing a visible distortion and adding 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool.
outcomes.6-: The bubble collapses violently, causing 1 Stun damage to everyone nearby.

description.short: Shift your consciousness outside of the normal flow of time for a single, frozen moment.
description.player: You step outside the river of time, observing the frozen world from a place between moments.

outcomes.10+: You get a clean 'pause' to observe and think, then act on your observation.
outcomes.7-9: The moment is jarring, costing you 1 Stun damage to your Intellect.
outcomes.6-: You are disoriented and lose your turn as you struggle to re-orient yourself.

description.short: Ranged attacks against you suffer a penalty, as you are never quite where you appear to be. This costs 2 Permanent Corruption.
description.player: You exist slightly out of phase with reality, making it difficult for attacks to find their true mark.

effects.description: Ranged attacks against you suffer a penalty due to spatial displacement

description.short: Instantly teleport to a single, specific location prepared with a complex ritual.
description.player: Through lengthy preparation, you create a dimensional anchor that allows instant escape.

outcomes.10+: You arrive instantly and safely at your prepared sanctuary.
outcomes.7-9: The journey is rough. You arrive disoriented and suffer 2 Stun damage, OR the portal is unstable, adding 1 DP.
outcomes.6-: The coordinates are corrupted. You teleport to a similar, but dangerous, location.

description.short: As a reaction to being attacked, you attempt to fold the space in front of you.
description.player: In the instant before impact, you warp reality itself to create distance where none exists.

outcomes.10+: You successfully warp reality. The attack stops short or is redirected.
outcomes.7-9: You partially bend the space and still take half damage.
outcomes.6-: You fail. The attack hits you as normal.

description.short: Unleash a wave of anti-Aether to cancel out an incoming magical effect.
description.player: You channel pure negation, the absence of magic itself, to unmake another's spell.

outcomes.10+: You utterly negate the effect. The spell fizzles, the psychic power fails.
outcomes.7-9: You succeed, but channeling pure nothingness costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: You fail to control the Void. The enemy's power affects you, and you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.

description.short: Wrap yourself in a shroud of Void that erases you from perception.
description.player: You cloak yourself in nothingness, becoming an absence that minds slide past without noticing.

outcomes.10+: You become utterly imperceptible—unseen, unheard, unremembered—for one full minute.
outcomes.7-9: The shroud is imperfect, leaving a disturbing feeling of 'wrongness' OR it costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: You become a terrifying, walking silhouette of pure blackness that draws immediate attention.

description.short: Touch a single, non-living object and unmake it, erasing it from existence.
description.player: You command the Void to consume, utterly erasing matter from reality.

outcomes.10+: The object is gone. Not broken, not vaporized. It simply ceases to be.
outcomes.7-9: The object is gone, but the Void also consumes a small, random item you are carrying OR you gain 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: The Void lashes out. The object is unaffected, but the backlash inflicts 2 Stun damage directly to you.

description.short: Manipulate the perceptions of a target, causing them to see, hear, or feel something that isn't there.
description.player: You reach into another's mind and paint false images across their senses.

outcomes.10+: The illusion is flawless and convincing, affecting all relevant senses for the scene.
outcomes.7-9: The illusion is imperfect. It has a subtle flaw, only affects one sense, OR costs you 1 Temporary Corruption.
outcomes.6-: Your attempt backfires, distorting your own senses for the next few minutes.

description.short: Project your consciousness into the Aether to travel through the sea of thought and dreams.
description.player: You sever your consciousness from your body, sending it forth into the dreaming realm of pure thought.

outcomes.10+: You enter the Aether smoothly and have clear control over your astral form.
outcomes.7-9: The journey is rough, inflicting 1 Stun damage to your Intellect OR you draw the attention of a native Aetheric spirit.
outcomes.6-: You get lost and are shunted to a random, dangerous corner of the Dreaming, or are violently ejected back to your body.

description.short: Enter a deep trance to perfectly recall and re-experience a past event you personally witnessed.
description.player: You dive deep into your own memory palace, reliving the past with perfect clarity.

outcomes.10+: Your recall is perfect. You can 'pause' and 'zoom', asking the GM two specific questions about details you could have perceived.
outcomes.7-9: The memory is tinged with emotional bias. You get to ask one question, but the memory is warped by your feelings at the time.
outcomes.6-: You become lost in the memory, trapped in the trance for an hour or more and emerging disoriented.
